title: Zero Waste Schools Programme: Zero waste schools programme launched in Ludhiana |
text: Ludhiana: A zero waste schools programme launched by the municipal corporation to encourage students in playing a greater role in reducing, reusing, and recycling solid waste in schools across the city, kickstarted during a workshop organised at Sacred Heart Convent School, Sarabha Nagar, on Thursday.Students from seven schools: Sacred Heart Convent School, Sarabha Nagar; Arya Senior Secondary School near Damoria bridge; BCM School, Metro Road; Govt Primary School, Jamalpur; Sai Public School, Barota Road; Ramgharia School near Vishkarma chowk; and Govt High School, Sarabha Nagar, participated in the event.The programme has been launched by the civic body in collaboration with the Council on Energy, Environment, and Water (CEEW) and the US Agency for International Development (USAID) as part of the Cleaner Air and Better Health (CABH) project. MC commissioner Sandeep Rishi, principal Veena D’Souza among others also participated in the one-day demonstration workshop, conducted by CEEW at Sacred Heart Convent School. The event was attended by students, teachers, principals, and municipal corporation officials. The workshop aimed to inspire a culture of sustainability in future generations through waste segregation and disposal.
